ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, C&C, Defence Medical Services (DMS)

TITLE.P: Procurement of Military Performance Analysis and Research Laboratory (MPARL)

SHORT_DESCR.P: The delivery, installation and maintenance of a High-End Military Performance Analysis and Research Laboratory (MPARL), including associated operating software and sustaining upgrade support package, to enable comprehensive biomechanical and physiological assessment of research participants and clinical patients for feedback as part of their treatment and rehabilitation.

The delivery, installation and maintenance of a High-End Military Performance Analysis and Research Laboratory (MPARL), including associated operating software and sustaining upgrade support package, to enable comprehensive biomechanical and physiological assessment of research participants and clinical patients for feedback as part of their treatment and rehabilitation.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The Authority intends to place a contract with Vicon for the provision of a Military Performance Analysis and Research Laboratory (MPARL). MPARL is a movement analysis laboratory, made up of a number of elements (such as motion capture cameras and force plates), that enables the objective measurement of biomechanical and physiological function. To undertake this work, MPARL must be capable of providing a comprehensive biomechanical and physiological assessment of research participants and clinical patients; thus contributing to clinical diagnosis, and; contributing to musculo-skeletal and neurological research in conjunction with other research departments.

It is considered this contract can be placed using the negotiated procedure without prior publication pursuant to Article 32(3)(a)of Directive 2014/24/EU and Regulation 32(5)(a) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (PCR 2015).

The Authority considers MPARL shall only be used for purposes of research, study and development, with no commercial viability or intention by the Authority to recover research and development costs in accordance with the requirements of Article 32(5)(a) PCR 2015.

Vicon shall provide the Authority with all elements that make up the MPARL — delivery, installation and maintenance. The Authority considers Vicon are the only company that can successfully bring all elements of the MPARL together to ensure compatibility between all component parts, including software and hardware to support multi-agency research and studies.

Placing a contract with Vicon for the development of motion capture cameras shall allow the continuation of current research programmes involving collaboration between the Authority and other research institutions also using Vicon cameras. These include key Authority stakeholders/partners in the realms of medical research, including Department of Defence, Imperial College London, Kings College London, Loughborough University, Exeter University, University of Salford, University of Bath and University of Surrey. A change to the motion capture camera systems the Authority uses will put at risk years of gathered data, collected for the purposes of research. Using another system, and different motion capture camera system technology would not allow for cross-referencing of collected data for on-going research studies. This would be a variable that could render the research and resultant findings unreliable, and Vicon is the only company able to offer such a service.

Compatibility of data is vital and every one of the bodies and research institutes DNRC work with, use the same motion capture Vicon camera system technology and associated software. Any risk of degrading collated data accuracy/relevance has to be negated. Clinical research by DNRC is of a collaborative nature as evidenced by the range of research produced in conjunction with other research institutes and would be at significant risk if products were procured from anyone other than Vicon.

CAREN also uses Vicon motion capture camera system technology and software systems. Collecting homogenous data from the CAREN and MPARL is high priority. Standardising data capture and processing between the two systems (using the same motion capture hardware and software) is an important step to reduce variability in data output, and Vicon are the only known company that allow this work to take place.

TITLE.P: Procurement of a Military Performance Analysis and Research Laboratory (MPARL)

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Unit 6, Oxford Industrial Park, Mead Road, Yarnton

INFO_ADD.P: The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
Advertising Regime OJEU: this contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU), the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk
